fact: Standing at 828 meters (2,717 feet) and boasting 163 floors, the Burj Khalifa in the United Arab Emirates is the world’s tallest building.
The nation of Iran is the world’s largest producer of pistachios, and the sweet green nut is the country’s second-largest export behind oil.
All three of the world’s major monotheistic religions – Christianity, Judaism, and Islam – were founded in the Middle East.
Though each region – Maghreb, Egypt, Levant, Iraq, Gulf – has its own distinct cuisine, most Middle Eastern food shares a common influence in traditional Ottoman recipes.
17 separate countries makes up the region known as The Middle East.

In 1993, the golden covering of the Dome of the Rock in Jerusalem was refurbished following a donation of $8.2 million by King Hussein of Jordan who sold one of his houses in London to fund the 80 kilograms of gold required.
In 2/3 of Middle Eastern countries, more women than men attend universities.
Turkey, Lebanon, Iran, and Jordan are among the top 10 refugee hosting nations in the world
350 million years ago, there existed a species of 20-foot tall mushroom in Saudi Arabia. It was likely the largest living thing on dry land at that time.
Due to its isolation, a third of the plant life on the island of Socotra (Yemen) is found nowhere else on the planet. It has been described as "most alien-looking place on Earth."
